snippet: Stricter gun control laws in other countries have worked to curtail firearm homicides.
abstract: Editorial observes that stricter gun control laws in other countries have worked to curtail firearm homicides; states American murder rate is roughly 15 times that of other wealthy countries, which have reacted quickly to impose new and stricter gun laws after suffering similar rampages to the one in Newtown, Conn.
lead_paragraph: Stricter gun control laws in other countries have worked to curtail firearm homicides.

headline.print_headline: In Other Countries, Laws Are Strict and Work
headline.seo: In Other Countries, Gun Laws Are Strict and Work
headline.main: In Other Countries, Laws Are Strict and Work
